Judul: COMPETING FRACTIONAL QUANTUM HALL AND ELECTRON SOLID PHASES IN GRAPHENE
Abstrak:
We report experimental observation of the reentrant integer quantum Hall effect in graphene, appearing
in the N ¼ 2 Landau level. Similar to high-mobility GaAs = AlGaAs heterostructures, the effect is due to a competition between incompressible fractional quantum Hall states, and electron solid phases. The tunability of graphene allows us to measure the B-T phase diagram of the electron solid phase. The
hierarchy of reentrant states suggests spin and valley degrees of freedom play a role in determining the
ground state energy. We find that the melting temperature scales with magnetic field, and construct a phase
diagram of the electron liquid-solid transition.
Fakultas: Fakultas Matematika dan Ilmu Pengetahuan Alam
Sumber: PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS 122, 026802 (2019); © 2019 American Physical Society
